teaspoon.app.standalone

Class TeaspoonMaskFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • teaspoon.app.standalone.TeaspoonMaskFactory
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    TeaspoonMaskFactoryTest

    public class TeaspoonMaskFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    TEASPOON: Tools for Evolutionary Analysis of Serially-sampled POpulatiONs Jayna Raghwani, Samir Bhatt, Joe Parker & Oliver G. Pybus University of Oxford, 2010-2018. TeaspoonMaskFactory provides simple methods to write sequence alignment masks to and from files for adaptation analyses.

    Masks are comprised of a single ratio estimation specification and a list of booleans exactly as long as the sequence alignment.

    Note that this is intended as a simple implementation, so very little safety checking is applied. In particular, there are no guarantees that masks are as long as the sequence alignemt they refer to, or to each other.

    Since:
    10 May 2018
    Version:
    0.1
    Author:
    @lonelyjoeparker
    See Also:
    TeaspoonMask, BhattAdaptationFullSitesMatrix, BhattAdaptationAnalysis, TeaspoonCommandLineApp, RateEstimationBehaviour

      • writeMaskFileWithFixedRatio

        public static boolean writeMaskFileWithFixedRatio(java.io.File maskFile,
                                                  java.util.HashMap<java.util.ArrayList<int[]>,RateEstimationBehaviour> masks,
                                                  int alignmentLength,
                                                  double ratio)
                                           throws java.io.IOException
        Writes a list of RateEstimationBehaviours and mask specifications to a named file. Coordinates are indexed to 0 not 1, e.g. first codon reads {0,1,2} not {1,2,3}
        Parameters:
        maskFile - - File to write to.
        masks - - hash of rate estimation behaviours (enum) and int[2] start, end positions for masks (one or more pairs per element)
        alignmentLength - - maximum alignment length to pad to.
        ratio - - double representing neutral ratio >= 0
        Returns:
        boolean if write operation is relatively successful.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
